definition: hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
(onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]

sentences.chinese: 演講者講得聲音都嘶啞了。

sentences.english: Out of control, Bonasera leaned forward toward the aisle and shouted hoarsely.
sentences.chinese: 失去了控制，勃納瑟拉向過道前傾，嘶啞地吼道。

sentences.english: Normal of the hoarseness were provided for clinical measurement.
sentences.chinese: 爲臨牀提供聲音嘶啞的客觀指標。

sentences.english: Persistent hoarseness, dry cough, blood in phlegm.
sentences.chinese: 持續性嘶啞，乾咳，痰中帶血。

sentences.english: But hoarseness can also be a sign of something worse.
sentences.chinese: 但聲音嘶啞也有可能是某些更糟糕疾病的症狀。

sentences.english: We want to really call attention to the fact that hoarseness is not just a symptom.
sentences.chinese: 我們想真正讓人們注意到，嘶啞不僅僅是一種症狀。

sentences.english: I sucked the throaty thin woe of a rabbit
sentences.chinese: 我吮吸出一隻兔子的痛苦，嘶啞而細弱的痛苦。

sentences.english: The teacher speaks wtih a husky voice.
sentences.chinese: 老師以嘶啞的聲音說話。

sentences.english: He has hoarse and has lost his voice sometimes.
So that he could catch cold and become a little hoarse.
sentences.chinese: 這樣他就可以着涼，嗓子就可以有些嘶啞。

sentences.english: The vestibule was filled with the unseemly sounds of scuffling and drunken, husky gasping.
sentences.chinese: 過廳充滿了一片亂糟糟的喧囂和醉漢嘶啞的喘息聲。

sentences.english: In the distance troops of red colobus gave honk calls, and crowned monkeys made their throaty booms.
sentences.chinese: 遠處一羣紅疣猴叫了起來，猴王發出嘶啞的鳴叫。

sentences.english: The hoarse grunt or squeal is characteristic of toxicity.
sentences.chinese: 嘶啞的哼聲和叫聲是中毒的特徵。

sentences.english: I was still so hoarse I could barely squeak out Thank you.
sentences.chinese: 我嗓子仍然嘶啞，連說聲“謝謝”都很勉強。

sentences.english: There is evidence?" He hoarsely the voice."

definition: (of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
